arts.ttl: Thomas Frank feels ‘nothing is going to be easy’ against Wolves
arts.sum: “It's a team we haven't been able to beat the last five times, so we're aware this is another game in the Premier League where you can take nothing for granted, you can't be thinking you can walk over any opponents. I've been these questions before in the past, and I was thinking, is it best to face a team that's unbeaten in 10 or a team that haven't won in 10?

arts.ttl: Tottenham injury news vs Wolves as Thomas Frank opens up on 'annoying' problem
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur host struggling Wolverhampton Wanderers this evening as they aim to return to winning ways in the Premier League after last week's draw at Brighton

arts.ttl: Wolves XI vs Tottenham Hotspur – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wolves travel to Tottenham on Saturday on the brink of unwanted history. Vítor Pereira’s side have lost all five of their Premier League games this season. A sixth consecutive defeat would see them become only the fourth team in the competition’s history to start a campaign in such a disastrous fashion. Despite their dreadful form, […] The post Wolves XI vs Tottenham Hotspur – Predicted lineup and team news first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Tottenham Hotspur vs Wolves – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur welcome Wolves to North London on Saturday, looking to consolidate their position in the top four and continue an impressive start under manager Thomas Frank. Spurs are unbeaten in their last 15 home league games against teams starting the day bottom of the table and will be strong favourites to extend that run. […] The post Tottenham Hotspur vs Wolves – Predicted lineup and team news first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Tottenham Hotspur vs Wolves – Match Preview and Team News
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur will aim to continue their strong start to the season on Saturday when they host a crisis-ridden Wolverhampton Wanderers side at the bottom of the table. While the form book points to a comfortable home win for Thomas Frank’s third-placed Spurs, Wolves have a remarkable recent record in this fixture, having won four […] The post Tottenham Hotspur vs Wolves – Match Preview and Team News first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Spurs v Wolves preview: Vitor Pereira ready to kickstart season
arts.sum: Pereira, who played a back four in that game and remained coy on which system he will utilise moving forward, now believes it is time for his side to start their season properly as they travel to the capital. "I feel the squad is more balanced than last season because we have two players for each position," Pereira said.

arts.ttl: Tottenham predicted lineup vs Wolves: Kudus, CBs return for Saturday night's clash
arts.sum: Spurs face the point-less Wolves in the Premier League on Saturday night.

arts.ttl: Wolves issue update on how many minutes Jorgen Strand Larsen could play vs Tottenham
arts.sum: Since recovering from injury, Larsen is yet to complete 90 minutes in any game and manager Vitor Pereira has now cast doubt on whether he can go the full distance against Spurs. Vitor Pereira says Jorgen Strand Larsen’s minutes need to be managed

arts.ttl: Spurs missing two attackers for Wolves clash
arts.sum: Pressed further on Solanke – given he trained at the start of this week – Frank explained: “When there’s a bit of pain, it’s just to see if we can get it right for right now. Asked specifically about Solanke, Frank said: “It’s an ankle injury which has just been a little bit tricky.

arts.ttl: defender has his say on Wolves' chances at Tottenham
arts.sum: “I think the team should go with the right attitude and I think we have a good chance to win the first Premier League game.” Wolves’ winless league start has left them rooted to the bottom of the table, but Bueno said victory over Everton has helped restore confidence.
